sources.title: Danger on Wheels
sources.description: An entertaining second feature auto racing yarn with a lively cast and lots of real track and stunt driving footage. The print is glitch free. Directed by Christy Cabanne. Released in 1940. One minute is missing. TRIVIA: Stunt driver Lester Simon sued Universal Pictures for use of his stunt driving footage without compensation.

sources.title: Danger on Wheels (1940) | Colorized Public Domain Racing Drama with Richard Arlen and Andy Devine
sources.description:
Danger on Wheels (1940) is an American racing drama directed by Christy Cabanne and released by Universal Pictures. This restored and colorized public domain film takes audiences into the thrilling world of auto racing at the height of Americaâ€™s fascination with speed, technology, and danger on the racetrack. By reviving this action-packed story in vivid modern color, Colorized Public Domain offers new life to a forgotten gem of Golden Age cinema for audiences in the United States, Europe, and beyond.

Plot Summary:
The film follows Larry Taylor (Richard Arlen), a daring test driver determined to make his mark in the competitive and perilous world of automobile racing. Larry is caught between ambition and safety as he develops and tests new high-speed cars on the track. His path is complicated by romance with Pat Oâ€™Shea (Peggy Moran), whose fatherâ€™s engineering business is closely tied to Larryâ€™s work, and by the rivalry of reckless drivers who put both pride and lives on the line.

Adding to the tension is the presence of Andy Devine as a comic yet loyal sidekick, bringing both humor and humanity to the otherwise dangerous atmosphere of the speedway. The film delivers suspenseful race sequences, personal drama, and moments of redemption as Larry risks everything to prove his skill, win love, and survive in a sport where one mistake can cost everything.

Cast and Crew:
â€¢ Director: Christy Cabanne
â€¢ Producer: Universal Pictures
â€¢ Screenplay: Robert Lee Johnson (story elements by Universal staff writers)
â€¢ Cinematography: Elwood Bredell
â€¢ Editing: Arthur Hilton

Starring:
â€¢ Richard Arlen as Larry Taylor
â€¢ Peggy Moran as Pat Oâ€™Shea
â€¢ Andy Devine as Buddy Butts
â€¢ Vinton Hayworth as Dick McCord
â€¢ Herbert Corthell as J.C. Oâ€™Shea
â€¢ Jack Arnold as Racer (supporting role)

Film Significance:
Danger on Wheels is part of the 1940s wave of racing-themed dramas that captured the excitement of speed, the risk of mechanical failure, and the courage of those who tested new technologies in the early years of auto racing. Richard Arlen, a leading man known for aviation and action films, brings charisma and determination to the role, while Andy Devineâ€™s signature voice and comedic timing add levity. Though not a major studio prestige release, the film represents Universalâ€™s contribution to the popular sports-drama genre of the era and remains an entertaining cultural artifact of pre-war Hollywood.

Enhanced Public Domain Explanation:
This film is in the public domain, which means it is completely free of copyright restrictions and can be legally shared, viewed, studied, and preserved without limitation. Colorized Public Domain restores and enhances these historic works through careful digital cleaning, visual restoration, and colorization techniques. Our mission is to ensure that timeless classics like Danger on Wheels remain available to a worldwide audience. By presenting them in color and modern quality, we make them more engaging and accessible to younger generations who might otherwise overlook black-and-white cinema. This process respects the original film while providing a new layer of appreciation for todayâ€™s viewers.

Why Watch This Colorized Edition:
The original 1940 release was in black and white, typical of its era. While authentic, many modern audiences are less drawn to monochrome films. By colorizing and restoring this racing drama, we bridge the gap between historical preservation and contemporary viewing habits. Modern audiences, especially those in the United States and Europe, can now enjoy the speed, tension, and energy of 1940s race cars in vivid color, making the experience more engaging and visually dynamic.

sources.title: Danger On Wheels (1940) RACE CAR CLASSIC
sources.description:
Stars: Richard Arlen, Andy Devine, Peggy Moran
Director: Christy Cabanne

A driver is killed when an experimental race car using an oil-fueled engine blows up. Lucky Taylor, a stunt driver, devises a scheme to have a car equipped with the engine entered into a race, without race officials--or the engine designer's sassy daughter--finding out about it.

sources.title: Danger on Wheels (1940) Racing Thriller | Fearless drivers fight for life!!!
sources.description:
During a test a race car using an experimental oil-fueled engine blows up, killing the driver. Lucky Taylor, a stunt driver, is initially blamed for the accident, but is later cleared. He thinks the engine design has a real chance to win races, but the racing association has banned it since the accident. He devises a scheme to have a car equipped with the engine entered into a race, without race officials--or the engine designer's sassy daughter--finding out about it.


Black & White version: https://youtu.be/t0qCFH-xFQQ

Main Actors:
Richard Arlen - Larry Taylor
Andy Devine - Gumpy Wesel
Peggy Moran - Pat O'Shea
Vinton Hayworth (as Jack Arnold) - Bruce Crowley 
Herbert Corthell - Pop O'Shea
Sandra King - June Allen
Landers Stevens - Lloyd B. Allen
Harry C. Bradley - Jones
Mary Treen - Esme
John Holmes - Eddie Dodds
Jack Rice - Parker


00:00 Full Movie with subtitles
01:14 Larry Taylor, a daring stunt driver, tests the experimental oil-fueled engine.
07:45 During a high-speed trial, the car explodes, tragically killing the driver.
15:30 Authorities unjustly blame Larry for the fatal accident.
23:10 Pat O'Shea, the engine designer's daughter, confronts Larry with accusations.
30:55 Larry uncovers sabotage evidence pointing to Bruce Crowley.
38:20 Teaming up, Larry and Pat secretly enter a race with the banned engine.
46:05 Bruce discovers their plan and plots to undermine them.
53:00 In a thrilling climax, Larry races to victory, clearing his name and proving the engine's worth.

He thinks the engine design has a real chance to win races, but the racing association has banned it since the accident. He devises a scheme to have a car equipped with the engine entered into a race, without race officials--or the engine designer's sassy daughter--finding out about it.
